channel.description: Data Sci, Quant Fin, Quant Bio.

item.title: "Tidymodels and conformal prediction"
item.description:
Reading material:

  1. The tidy modeling book
  2. The tidymodels blog on conformal regression
  3. The notes of Angelopoulos
  4. The notes of Tibshirani
  5. The book of Christoph Molnar
  6. The book of Valeriy Manokhin
  7. The package of Sussman et al.

Getting some data

We will look at Indian trade data hosted on Kaggle for …
item.dc:creator: pras

item.title: "R, Torch, and the little book of deep learning"
item.description:
These notes are meant to implement little examples from Francois Fleuret's Little Book of Deep Learning (pdf link) in r-torch. I'm writing these as a fun way to dive into torch in R while surveying DL quickly.

You'll need to have the book with you to understand these notes, but …

item.title: "Becoming a Data Scientist : an opinionated take in 2020"
item.description: There are many articles on this subject, and many of them are excellent. For some examples see here, here, here and here. All such articles are opinionated takes, and articles like these did help when I was starting out in data science some years ago. Contrary to my expectations, the …

item.title: "Linear and mixed integer programming"
item.description:
post inspired by the OptiPy meetup. link to meetup

Linear programming

Optimisation problems where the constraints and cost function are linear, and the decision variables are continuous, are the simple, canonical domain of linear programming. However, such problems can be solved in polynomial time, which means that to tackle a …
item.dc:creator: pras

item.title: "The Invisible Hand"
item.description:
Markets and financial time series data.

Basic ideas about markets

Inevitably, finance and markets will be a recurring subject of discussion on this blog. They are ubiquitous, useful, fascinatingly complex at various levels and they generate a lot of readily accessible data.

What is a market ? A market is a …

item.title: "greta playground"
item.description:
A first foray into probabilistic programming with Greta

Models and modelling

Much of science - physical and social - is devoted to positing mechanisms that explain how the data we observe are generated. In a classic example, after Tycho Brahe made detailed observations of planetary motion (here is data on mars), Johannes …
item.dc:creator: pras

item.title: "Notes from the original ML course by Andrew Ng"
item.description:
These are notes I took while watching the lectures from Andrew Ng's ML course. There is no code, just some math and my take aways from the course. It should still serve as a useful first document to skim for someone just starting out with machine learning.

What can ML …

item.title: I once was lost... but now am Dad ?
item.description: And so there she is, our baby daughter. Even after a fairly uneventful pregnancy, the birth of a baby must be among the most epic things men can witness and women can experience. The pain that women go through alone makes the experience singular, even without a whole new person …

item.title: Tiger Hill
item.description:
1.

"I've checked", the Principal said one morning at assembly "The hill behind the school does not seem to have a name. In the memory of those who died in Kashmir, we will call it Tiger Hill. So that we never forget."

It was the monsoon of 1999. I stood …
